intro: Centaurea boissieri subsp. pomeliana, commonly known as the Pomelina bluemink, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It features upright, branching stems covered in dense, grayish-blue foliage. The plant produces striking purple to pink flower heads composed of ray florets and central disc florets. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or limestone habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and ornamental species in its native environment.
